commentBody: With respect to reducing the number of collisions in a game, another reform would be to require 'wrapping up' during a tackle.  Many defensive players launch themselves at a receiver, trying to separate the ball from the player.  The rules should be changed so that the defender has to actually tackle the player.   By using their arms in the tackle, the impacts would be reduced, and thus the amount of injuries.  Knocking into the ball carrier should be allowed only near the sidelines, in an attempt to knock him out of bounds.  In the center of the field, require tackling.
